intro: Strychnos canthioides, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including savannas and forest edges, and is often found in well-drained soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
